snippet: Increasingly, social technology businesses are taking an antisocial attitude to callers, making themselves available to customers via e-mail, Twitter messages and Web sites.
abstract: Social technology businesses are increasingly unlikely to provide live phone support for their customers, citing limited staff and the advantages of e-mail and automated systems; trend has frustrated many older users who are accustomed to speaking with a real person when service is problematic.
lead_paragraph: Increasingly, social technology businesses are taking an antisocial attitude to callers, making themselves available to customers via e-mail, Twitter messages and Web sites.

headline.seo: Tech Companies Leave Phone Calls Behind
